metadata.title: CVE-2010-2496 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
stonith-ng in pacemaker and cluster-glue passed passwords as commandlineparameters, making it possible for local attackers to gain access topasswords of the HA stack and potentially influence its operations. This isfixed in cluster-glue 1.0.6 and newer, and pacemaker 1.1.3 and newer.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-2496` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcib4 - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1
libcrmcluster4 - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1
libcrmcommon3 - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1
libcrmservice3 - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1
liblrmd1 - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1
libpe-rules2 - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1
libpe-status10 - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1
libpengine10 - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1
libstonithd2 - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1
libtransitioner2 - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1
pacemaker - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1
pacemaker-cli-utils - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1
pacemaker-common - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1
pacemaker-remote - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1
pacemaker-resource-agents - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: pacemaker package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.1.14-2ubuntu1').
